org.itsnat.comp.tree
Interface ItsNatTreeCellUI

All Superinterfaces:
ItsNatUserData
public interface ItsNatTreeCellUI
extends ItsNatUserData

Contains visual information of a tree node.

This interface is the "componentized" version of ElementTreeNode and follows a similar philosophy. The objective is similar to ItsNatListCellUI applied to tree nodes. Child index, row, tree path, deep level etc are tolerant to tree changes (are automatically updated).

Author:
Jose Maria Arranz Santamaria
See Also:
ItsNatTreeUI.getItsNatTreeCellUIFromRow(int), ItsNatTreeUI.getItsNatTreeCellUIFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node)

getItsNatTreeUI

ItsNatTreeUI getItsNatTreeUI()
Returns the parent tree UI this object belongs to.

Returns:
the parent tree UI.

getTreeNodeUIParent

ItsNatTreeCellUI getTreeNodeUIParent()
Returns the parent tree node UI of this node.

Returns:
the parent tree node UI.

getTreeNodeUIPath

ItsNatTreeCellUI[] getTreeNodeUIPath()
Returns an array with tree node UI objects from this node to the top most (usually the root).

Element at 0 is the top most node; if this tree is not rootless 0 element is the root, otherwise is the top most parent node containing this node.

Returns:
an array with this object and any parent tree node UI.

getRow

int getRow()
Returns the row index of this node seeing the tree as a list. 0 if this node is the root regardless this tree is rootless or not (if rootless never returns 0 because root node has not markup/tree node UI).

Returns:
the row index of this node seeing the tree as a list.
See Also:
ItsNatTreeUI.getItsNatTreeCellUIFromRow(int)

expand

void expand(boolean expandState)
Sets the new expand state.

Current implementation does not perform DOM changes and only serves to save expand state. Future versions might use this method to render visually the markup effect of the expansion/collapse.

Expand state of child or parent nodes is not affected.

Parameters:
expandState - the new state.
See Also:
isExpanded(), ItsNatTree.expandNode(javax.swing.tree.TreePath), ItsNatTree.collapseNode(javax.swing.tree.TreePath)

isExpanded

boolean isExpanded()
Returns the current expand state.

Returns:
the current expand state, true by default.
See Also:
expand(boolean), ItsNatTree.isExpandedNode(javax.swing.tree.TreePath)

getDeepLevel

int getDeepLevel()
Returns the deep (number of parents) of this node. If this node is root or a top most (rootless case) returns 0.

Returns:
the deep level of this node.

getTreePath

javax.swing.tree.TreePath getTreePath()
Returns the tree path of this node.

Returns:
the tree path.
